transcript.text: how did we as a society come to make
this distinction that red means no or
stop and green means yes or go what is
the origin of this cultural distinction
it's possible that it's perfectly
arbitrary but I doubt it I suspect it
would be pretty hard to devise a culture
in which red means go and green means
stop because it's probably something
about our innate conception of the way
colors relate to action but again we're
entering into unknown Terrain here you
have to investigate this so wienstein
raised a famous question about a line
with a arrow head pointing out why do we
Follow the arrow in this direction and
not in the other direction an arrow head
at one end of the line and he argued
it's just a social convention but it
surely isn't if you did experimental
work you would find that probably dogs
would interpret it that probably infants
would because it's just part of our
buil-in nature to interpret you
